verses.verse: After<WH310> these things,<WH1697> and this faithfulness,<WH571> Sennacherib<WH5576> king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> came,<WH935> and entered<WH935> into Judah,<WH3063> and encamped<WH2583> against the fortified<WH1219> cities,<WH5892> and thought<WH559> to win them for himself.<WH1234>
When Hezekiah<WH3169> saw<WH7200> that Sennacherib<WH5576> had come,<WH935> and that he was purposed<WH6440> to fight<WH4421> against Jerusalem,<WH3389>

he took counsel<WH3289> with his princes<WH8269> and his mighty men<WH1368> to stop<WH5640> the waters<WH4325> of the springs<WH5869> which were outside<WH2351> of the city;<WH5892> and they helped him.<WH5826>

So many<WH7227> people<WH5971> gathered<WH6908> together,<WH6908> and they stopped<WH5640> all the springs,<WH4599> and the brook<WH5158> that flowed<WH7857> through the midst<WH8432> of the land,<WH776> saying,<WH559> "Why should the kings<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> come,<WH935> and find<WH4672> much<WH7227> water?<WH4325>"

He took courage,<WH2388> and built up<WH1129> all the wall<WH2346> that was broken<WH6555> down,<WH5927> and raised it up to the towers,<WH4026> and the other<WH312> wall<WH2346> outside,<WH2351> and strengthened<WH2388> Millo<WH4407> in the city<WH5892> of David,<WH1732> and made<WH6213> weapons<WH7973> and shields<WH4043> in abundance.<WH7230>

He set<WH5414> captains<WH8269> of war<WH4421> over the people,<WH5971> and gathered them together<WH6908> to him in the broad<WH7339> place at the gate<WH8179> of the city,<WH5892> and spoke<WH1696> comfortably<WH3824> to them,<WH559> saying,

"Be strong<WH2388> and courageous,<WH553> don't<WH3372> be afraid nor dismayed<WH2865> for<WH6440> the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> nor for all the multitude<WH1995> who is with him;<WH7227> for there is a greater with us than with him.

With him is an arm<WH2220> of flesh;<WH1320> but with us is Yahweh<WH3068> our God<WH430> to help<WH5826> us,<WH3898> and to fight our battles.<WH4421>" The people<WH5971> rested<WH5564> themselves on the words<WH1697> of Hezekiah<WH3169> king<WH4428> of Judah.<WH3063>

After<WH310> this,<WH5576> Sennacherib king<WH4428> of Assyria<WH804> sent<WH7971> his servants<WH5650> to Jerusalem,<WH3389> (now he was before Lachish,<WH3923> and all his power<WH4475> with him<WH3169>), to Hezekiah king<WH4428> of Judah,<WH3063> and to all Judah<WH3063> who were at Jerusalem,<WH3389> saying,<WH559>
Thus says<WH559> Sennacherib<WH5576> king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> "In whom do you trust,<WH982> that you remain<WH3427> under siege<WH4692> in Jerusalem?<WH3389>

Doesn't<WH3169> Hezekiah persuade<WH5496> you,<WH5414> to give you over to die<WH4191> by famine<WH7458> and by thirst,<WH6772> saying,<WH559> <WH3068> 'Yahweh our God<WH430> will deliver<WH5337> us out of the hand<WH3709> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria?<WH804>'

Hasn't<WH3169> the same Hezekiah taken away<WH5493> his high places<WH1116> and his altars,<WH4196> and commanded<WH559> Judah<WH3063> and Jerusalem,<WH3389> saying,<WH559> <WH7812> 'You shall worship before<WH6440> one<WH259> altar,<WH4196> and on it you shall burn incense?<WH6999>'

Don't<WH3045> you know what I and my fathers<WH1> have done<WH6213> to all the peoples<WH5971> of the lands?<WH776> Were the gods<WH430> of the nations<WH1471> of the lands<WH776> in any way<WH3201> able<WH3201> to deliver<WH5337> their land<WH776> out of my hand?<WH3027>

Who was there among all the gods<WH430> of those nations<WH1471> which my fathers<WH1> utterly destroyed,<WH2763> that could<WH3201> deliver<WH5337> his people<WH5971> out of my hand,<WH3027> that your God<WH430> should be able<WH3201> to deliver<WH5337> you out of my hand?<WH3027>

Now therefore don't<WH3808> let Hezekiah<WH2396> deceive<WH5377> you,<WH5496> nor persuade you in this way,<WH539> neither believe him;<WH433> for no god of any nation<WH1471> or kingdom<WH4467> was able<WH3201> to deliver<WH5337> his people<WH5971> out of my hand,<WH3027> and out of the hand<WH3027> of my fathers.<WH1> How much less will your God<WH430> deliver<WH5337> you out of my hand?<WH3027>"
His servants<WH5650> spoke<WH1696> yet more against Yahweh<WH3068> God,<WH430> and against his servant<WH5650> Hezekiah.<WH3169>

He also wrote<WH3789> letters<WH5612> insulting<WH2778> Yahweh,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> and to speak<WH559> against him,<WH559> saying, "As the gods<WH430> of the nations<WH1471> of the lands,<WH776> which have not delivered<WH5337> their people<WH5971> out of my hand,<WH3027> so shall the God<WH430> of Hezekiah<WH3169> not deliver<WH5337> his people<WH5971> out of my hand.<WH3027>"

They cried<WH7121> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963> in the Jews<WH3066>' language to the people<WH5971> of Jerusalem<WH3389> who were on the wall,<WH2346> to frighten<WH3372> them,<WH926> and to trouble them;<WH3920> that they might take the city.<WH5892>
They spoke<WH1696> of<WH5921> the God<WH430> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> as of the gods<WH430> of the peoples<WH5971> of the earth,<WH776> which are the work<WH4639> of men<WH120>'s hands.<WH3027>
Hezekiah<WH3169> the king,<WH4428> and Isaiah<WH3470> the prophet<WH5030> the son<WH1121> of Amoz,<WH531> prayed<WH6419> because of this,<WH2199> and cried to heaven.<WH8064>

Yahweh<WH3068> sent<WH7971> an angel,<WH4397> who cut off<WH3582> all the mighty men<WH1368> of valor,<WH2428> and the leaders<WH5057> and captains,<WH8269> in the camp<WH4264> of the king<WH4428> of Assyria.<WH804> So he returned<WH7725> with shame<WH1322> of face<WH6440> to his own land.<WH776> When he had come<WH935> into the house<WH1004> of his god,<WH430> those who came forth<WH3329> from his own bowels<WH4578> killed<WH5307> him there with the sword.<WH2719>

Thus Yahweh<WH3068> saved<WH3467> Hezekiah<WH3169> and the inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem<WH3389> from the hand<WH3027> of Sennacherib<WH5576> the king<WH4428> of Assyria,<WH804> and from the hand<WH3027> of all others,<WH5095> and guided them on every side.<WH5439>

Many<WH7227> brought<WH935> gifts<WH4503> to Yahweh<WH3068> to Jerusalem,<WH3389> and precious<WH4030> things to Hezekiah<WH3169> king<WH4428> of Judah;<WH3063> so that he was exalted<WH5375> in the sight<WH5869> of all nations<WH1471> from thenceforth.<WH310>
In those days<WH3117> Hezekiah<WH3169> was sick<WH2470> even to death:<WH4191> and he prayed<WH6419> to Yahweh;<WH3068> and he spoke<WH559> to him,<WH5414> and gave him a sign.<WH4159>

But Hezekiah<WH3169> didn't<WH7725> render again according to the benefit<WH1576> done to him;<WH3820> for his heart was lifted up:<WH1361> therefore there was wrath<WH7110> on him,<WH3063> and on Judah and Jerusalem.<WH3389>

Notwithstanding Hezekiah<WH3169> humbled<WH3665> himself for the pride<WH1363> of his heart,<WH3820> both he and the inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem,<WH3389> so that the wrath<WH7110> of Yahweh<WH3068> didn't<WH935> come on them in the days<WH3117> of Hezekiah.<WH3169>

Hezekiah<WH3169> had exceeding<WH3966> much<WH7235> riches<WH6239> and honor:<WH3519> and he provided<WH6213> him treasuries<WH214> for silver,<WH3701> and for gold,<WH2091> and for precious<WH3368> stones,<WH68> and for spices,<WH1314> and for shields,<WH4043> and for all kinds of goodly<WH2532> vessels;<WH3627>
storehouses<WH4543> also for the increase<WH8393> of grain<WH1715> and new wine<WH8492> and oil;<WH3323> and stalls<WH723> for all kinds of animals,<WH929> and flocks<WH5739> in folds.<WH220>

Moreover he provided<WH6213> him cities,<WH5892> and possessions<WH4735> of flocks<WH6629> and herds<WH1241> in abundance;<WH7230> for God<WH430> had given<WH5414> him very<WH3966> much<WH7227> substance.<WH7399>

This same Hezekiah<WH3169> also stopped<WH5640> the upper<WH5945> spring<WH4161> of the waters of Gihon,<WH1521> and brought them straight<WH3474> down<WH4295> on the west side<WH4628> of the city<WH5892> of David.<WH1732> Hezekiah<WH3169> prospered<WH6743> in all his works.<WH4639>

However<WH3651> concerning the ambassadors<WH3887> of the princes<WH8269> of Babylon,<WH894> who sent<WH7971> to him to inquire<WH1875> of the wonder<WH4159> that was done in the land,<WH776> God<WH430> left<WH5800> him,<WH5254> to try him,<WH3045> that he might know all that was in his heart.<WH3824>

Now the rest<WH3499> of the acts<WH1697> of Hezekiah,<WH3169> and his good<WH2617> deeds,<WH3789> behold, they are written in the vision<WH2377> of Isaiah<WH3470> the prophet<WH5030> the son<WH1121> of Amoz,<WH531> in the book<WH5612> of the kings<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> and Israel.<WH3478>

Hezekiah<WH3169> slept<WH7901> with his fathers,<WH1> and they buried<WH6912> him in the ascent<WH4608> of the tombs<WH6913> of the sons<WH1121> of David:<WH1732> and all Judah<WH3063> and the inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem<WH3389> did him<WH6213> honor<WH3519> at his death.<WH4194> Manasseh<WH4519> his son<WH1121> reigned in his place.<WH4427>
